name: PHENOXYBENZAMINE HYDROCHLORIDE
cautions:
Cautions elderly; congestive
heart failure; severe ischaemic heart disease (see also Contra-indications); cerebrovascular disease (avoid if history of cerebrovascular accident); monitor
blood pressure regularly during infusion; carcinogenic in animals; avoid in acute porphyria (section 9.8.2); avoid extravasation (irritant
to tissues)
side-effects:
Side-effects postural hypotension with dizziness and marked
compensatory tachycardia, lassitude, nasal congestion, miosis, inhibition
of ejaculation; rarely gastro-intestinal disturbances; decreased sweating
and dry mouth after intravenous infusion; idiosyncratic profound hypotension
within few minutes of starting infusion; convulsions following rapid
intravenous infusion also reported
doses:
phaeochromocytoma, 10 mg daily, increased by 10 mg daily;
usual dose 1–2 mg/kg daily in 2 divided doses
pregnancy: Pregnancy hypotension may occur in newborn
